'''Methedras''' ([[Sindarin]] for "Last Peak") was the southernmost peak of the [[Misty Mountains]].<ref>{{TT|Riders}}, p. 429</ref> Upon its eastern slopes sprang the [[Entwash]] River, which flowed into the western edge of [[Fangorn Forest]], growing about the base of the mountain.<ref>{{TT|Treebeard}}, p. 469</ref>

To the south, Methedras stood above [[Isengard]] in the valley of [[Nan Curunír]]. The sources of the river [[Isen]] were at the southern end of hte [[Misty Mountains]], probably on the southern slopes of Methedras.<ref>[[Christopher Tolkien]], [[General Map of Middle-earth]]</ref> On [[3 March]] {{TA|3019}}<ref>{{App|Great}}</ref> the [[Ents]] diverted the waters of the Isen to flow into Isengard, flooding its pits and creating a lake about the tower.<ref>{{TT|Flotsam}}</ref>

==Etymology==
''Methedras'' is a [[Sindarin]] name,<ref name="Eldamo">{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-743583263.html|articlename=S. ''Methedras'' loc.|website=Eldamo|accessed=28 May 2025}}</ref> which means "Last Peak"<ref>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Methedras'', p. 366</ref>, It is probably a combination of ''[[methed]]'' ("end") and ''[[ras]]'' ("horn").<ref name="Eldamo"/>

==Other versions of the legendarium==
In the draft version of "[[The Riders of Rohan]]", ''Methedras'' was named ''Methen Amon''.  This name would be changed to ''Methendol'' before the final name of ''Methedras'' was adopted.<ref>{{TI|XX}}, note 18</ref>

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
'''2011: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:In addition to being prominently visible from within [[Isengard]], the western slope of the mountain is explorable as the "Tâl Methedras" area, home to the "Tûr Morva" village of the [[Dunlendings]].
